thread.title: Bank of America’s Cathy Bessant to receive lifetime honor

author: Hilary Burns
title: Bank of America’s Cathy Bessant to receive lifetime honor
text:
Comments 
Cathy Bessant will receive the Charlotte Business Journal’s Lifetime Achievement Award at the annual Women in Business Awards program March 16. 
Bessant, Bank of America’s chief operations and technology officer, has worn many hats at the company including a regional market president role in Florida, chief marketing officer and president of global product solutions and global treasury services. Today, she is one the bank’s C-suite leaders based in Charlotte, overseeing about 95,000 technology employees and contractors in 35 countries. 
Bessant has a litany of awards and honors on her resume. The bank executive ranks No. 1 on Institutional Investor magazine’s most recent annual list of financial technology leaders, she has appeared multiple times on American Banker ’s Most Powerful Women in Banking list and she’s has been named InformationWeek ’s “Chief of the Year.” See Also Bank of America's Cathy Bessant on fintech, innovation and more 
She was also awarded The Order of the Long Leaf Pine in 2016, an award from the governor for “exemplary service to the state of North Carolina and their communities that is above and beyond the call of duty.” 
Bessant is considered a thought leader in the emerging financial technology space — an area Charlotte-based Bank of America is keeping a close eye on as the bank continues to innovate and enhance its products and services. 
Last June, Bessant told an audience at the AvidXchange Music Factory that Charlotte would become a place known for its fintech companies and innovations. 
“A fintech hub in Charlotte will happen,” Bessant said . “That is going to be in the future, a statement that can be made with clarity and certainty. There is a mandate for it locally in terms of the diversification of the economy and continuing to attract talent to the region.” Page
